pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:0.5_0: The training rule on squatting on the heels
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were squatting on their heels while walking in inhabited areas. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not squat on my heels while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.4_0: One should not squat on one’s heels while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, squats on his heels while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.9_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on fifth, is finished.
